column4: Here's my problem: lately I've had a hard time logging onto SSH by remote. Sometimes the connect dies after giving pw, sometimes after displaying "last login" but before the prompt. Is this just SSH being unstable?
Should I set up something like automatic restart of ssh in crontab, or will that not help, you think?
someone might be knocking at your door massively
would that do it? I am running a few torrents from time to time, are those enough to kill ssh?
what i can advice you is to change the default ssh port to something different and see then
my bet is that the problem disappeares at once :)
nope, I already am running on a nonstandard port
so perhaps it's time to change the port?
that's what i think, i change the port everyday...
that's why you should use port knocking if you really care about security
i had that before when i was short on space in /var
I have ubuntu installed on its own hard drive, and there's still over 100gig free on that
so what is this about PAM you mentioned?
